definition: one of the channels of TCM
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: Explain the circulation of Hand-Jueyin, Hand-Shaoyang meridians.
sentences.chinese: 分析讲解手厥阴经，手少阳经的经脉循行。

definition: (TCM) the three truncal cavities (thoracic, abdominal and pelvic), known as the "triple heater" or "San Jiao"
half outside, half inside/half interior, half exterior

acupuncture point (any point on any meridian)/category of 12 specific acupuncture points near the wrist or ankle, each lying on a different meridian (one of five categories collectively termed 五輸穴|五输穴)
chest and hypochondrium/upper part of the body
location on wrist over the radial artery where pulse is taken in TCM
superficial syndrome/illness that has not attacked the vital organs of the human body

(TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
